bibl.title: Two Coptic Epitaphs from Qasr Ibrim.
bibl.note: 1. Funerary stela of a woman called Martha [in Coptic]. Rijksmuseum van Oudheden, Leiden, Inv. F 1985/4.2. Qasr Ibrim, ca. eight century? - 2. Funerary stela of Patarmoute, priest of the Catholic church [in Coptic, with a Greek sentence]. Present location unknown (the text is reproduced after a handwritten transcription by Reginald Engelbach, now in the Griffith Institute, Oxford, with some pencil annotations by W.E. Crum). Qasr Ibrim, ninth-tenth century? - Concluding remarks. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Jacques van der Vliet, Two Coptic Epitaphs from Qasr Ibrim.

1. Funerary stela of a woman called Martha [in Coptic]. Rijksmuseum van Oudheden, Leiden, Inv. F 1985/4.2. Qasr Ibrim, ca. eight century? - 2. Funerary stela of Patarmoute, priest of the Catholic church [in Coptic, with a Greek sentence]. Present location unknown (the text is reproduced after a handwritten transcription by Reginald Engelbach, now in the Griffith Institute, Oxford, with some pencil annotations by W.E. Crum). Qasr Ibrim, ninth-tenth century? - Concluding remarks. - Avec résumé en anglais.
